page.title: 14Strathmiglo Games
page.content: In 1600 a charter was granted which gave Strathmiglo the status of a Burgh of Barony.The feuars were given the power to hold courts,exact fines,of holding a tolbooth,a pair of gallows a weekly market and two yearly markets. The yearly markets were held on the ninth day of June,the feast of Saint Cyralus and the twenty fifth day of October,the feast of Saint Crispean. The Strathmiglo Games are now held annually on the village green,on the first Saturday in June.There are various events at the games,such as track, cycle and field events,highland dancing and piping. Another event at the games is an inter-schools relay race. Strathmiglo, Gateside and Auchtermuchty Primary Schools compete. This year Strathmiglo won.The games are sposored every year by various companies throughout Fife.
